item.name: Retrieves the account transaction list of a Santander customer.

header.description:
Overall ID of the trace, shared by every span in the trace. 

The value is 64 or 128 bits long.

Position of the parent operation in the trace tree.

The value is 64 bits long. 

The value is omitted when the span is the root of the trace tree.

Position of the current operation in the trace tree.

The value is 64 bits long.

Do not interpret the value: it may or may not be derived from the value of the TraceId.

Sampling decision.

Sampling is a mechanism to reduce the volume of data in the tracing system. In B3, sampling applies consistently per-trace: once the sampling decision is made, the same value must be consistently sent downstream. This means that either all or no spans share a trace ID.

The possible values are: 
- 0 = Deny
- 1 = Accept
- d = Debug

Device information permitted for the data query. 

You can use this parameter to apply an experience base to optimize data collection.
(Required) Client ID header

Channel access agreement ID.

If a value is provided for this parameter, the requested data is retrieved only if the defined channel access agreement authorises the logged-in person to access that data.

Access channel or operating channel the customer is using. 

If a value is provided for this parameter, the response includes the alias for the specific channel. 

The possible values are:
- web
- mobile
- back office

Strong Customer Authentication (SCA) token.

The token contains the SCA evidence to confirm that the operation is validated by the SCA regulation system. The token is validated by the local system.

query.description:
Number of pages to be omitted from the beginning of the response.

The number of rows on each omitted page is determined by the '_limit' parameter.

The default value is 0, in which case the first page is shown.

Maximum number of rows to be included on each page in the response.

Fewer rows can be returned, if the query does not yield that many.

The default value is 20.

Start date for the time period from which transactions are to be retrieved, based on the date when the transactions have been originally created. 

The date format is 'yyyyMMddThhmmssfff±timezone', where fff are milliseconds.

End date for the time period from which transactions are to be retrieved, based on the date when the transactions have been originally created. 

The date format is 'yyyyMMddThhmmssfff±timezone', where fff are milliseconds.

Start date for the time period from which transactions are to be retrieved, based on the date when the transactions have been processed in the system. 

The date format is 'yyyyMMddThhmmssfff±timezone', where fff are milliseconds.

End date for the time period from which transactions are to be retrieved, based on the date when the transactions have been processed in the system. 

The date format is 'yyyyMMddThhmmssfff±timezone', where fff are milliseconds.

Start date for the time period from which transactions are to be retrieved, based on the accounting date of the transactions (the date used to calculate the profit and loss). 

The date format is 'yyyyMMddThhmmssfff±timezone', where fff are milliseconds.

End date for the time period from which transactions are to be retrieved, based on the accounting date of the transactions (the date used to calculate the profit and loss). 

The date format is 'yyyyMMddThhmmssfff±timezone', where fff are milliseconds.

Minimum monetary transaction value required for the transaction to be included in the response.

Both negative and positive values are allowed.

Maximum monetary transaction value required for the transaction to be included in the response.

Both negative and positive values are allowed.

Sorting order for the retrieved transactions, based on the transaction date type defined in the 'date_movements' parameter. 

The possible values are:
- +date = ascending
- -date = descending

Types of transaction to be included in the response, based on how the transaction affects the account balance. 

The possible values are:
- credit or C = balance increased
- debit or D = balance decreased
- reverse credit or RC = balance decreased
- reverse debit or RD = balance increased

If this value is empty, all transaction types are included. This parameter is not compatible with the 'from_amount' and 'to_amount' parameters. If you have defined values for those, leave this parameter empty.

Date type used to sort the transactions in the response. 

The possible values are:
- creation = creation dates are used
- processed = processing dates are used
- accounting = accounting dates are used

If the value is omitted, the default value is 'creation'.

Format used for the account number in the 'account_id' parameter.

The possible values are:
- IBA = IBAN code
- BBA = Basic Bank Account Number (BBAN) that represents a country-specific bank account number. Each country has its own standards for the format and length of the BBAN. The value is at most 31 char or 35 bytes long. 

For example: 
- In UK, the BBAN is: Sort code(6) + Account(8)
- In Spain, it is: Banco(4) + Sucursal(4) + CD(2) + CTA(10)

The default value is BBA.

variable.description:
(Required) Number of the account to be used in the query. 

The number format is defined in the 'account_id_type' parameter.

request.description:
Retrieves a list of transactions for a specific savings, current, or credit account. This operation is available to Santander staff, in addition to physical and business customers.

To send this request, you must provide an account number in the request path. The number uses the BBAN format by default. To use another format, define the format in the 'account_id_type' parameter.

The transactions included in the response can be filtered by a time period (start and end dates), transaction type, currency, and amount. You can also sort them in descending or ascending order by date.

The maximum available time period depends on the local bank.

response.name: OK

query.description:
Format used for the account number in the 'account_id' parameter.

The possible values are:
- IBA = IBAN code
- BBA = Basic Bank Account Number (BBAN) that represents a country-specific bank account number. Each country has its own standards for the format and length of the BBAN. The value is at most 31 char or 35 bytes long. 

For example:

- In Spain, it is: Banco(4) + Sucursal(4) + CD(2) + CTA(10)

variable.description:
(Required) Number of the account to be used in the query. 

The number format is defined in the 'account_id_type' parameter.
(Required) ID of the transaction to be included in the response

request.description:
Retrieves the details of a specific account transaction. This operation is available to Santander staff, in addition to physical and business customers.

To send this request, you must provide an account number and a unique transaction ID in the request path. The account number uses the BBAN format by default. To use another format, define the format in the 'account_id_type' parameter.

header.description:
Overall ID of the trace, shared by every span in the trace. 

The value is 64 or 128 bits long.

Position of the parent operation in the trace tree.

The value is 64 bits long. 

The value is omitted when the span is the root of the trace tree.

Position of the current operation in the trace tree.

The value is 64 bits long.

Do not interpret the value: it may or may not be derived from the value of the TraceId.

Sampling decision.

Sampling is a mechanism to reduce the volume of data in the tracing system. In B3, sampling applies consistently per-trace: once the sampling decision is made, the same value must be consistently sent downstream. This means that either all or no spans share a trace ID.

The possible values are: 
- 0 = Deny
- 1 = Accept
- d = Debug

Device information permitted for the data query. 

You can use this parameter to apply an experience base to optimize data collection.
(Required) Client ID header

query.description:
Format used for the account number in the 'account_id' parameter.

The possible values are:
- IBA = IBAN code
- BBA = Basic Bank Account Number (BBAN) that represents a country-specific bank account number. Each country has its own standards for the format and length of the BBAN. The value is at most 31 char or 35 bytes long. 

For example: 
- In UK, the BBAN format is: Sort code(6) + Account(8)
- In Spain, it is: Banco(4) + Sucursal(4) + CD(2) + CTA(10)

The default value is BBA.

variable.description:
(Required) Number of the account for which a limit is created. 

The number format is defined in the 'account_id_type' parameter.

request.description:
Creates a limit for a specific account. This operation is available for Santander staff only.

To send this request, you must provide an account number in the request path. The number uses the BBAN format by default. To use another format, define the format in the 'account_id_type' parameter.

When an account credit movement is expected, but not yet booked, a limit can be used to temporarily approve a specific overdraft limit for the account.

The created limit has an impact on the overdraft limit of the account, and consequently also on the available balance. The limit is removed:
- When the limit amount is booked on the account using a matching limit ID
- Automatically after its validity period ends

query.description:
Format used for the account number in the 'account_id' parameter.

The possible values are:
- IBA = IBAN code
- BBA = Basic Bank Account Number (BBAN) that represents a country-specific bank account number. Each country has its own standards for the format and length of the BBAN. The value is at most 31 char or 35 bytes long. 

For example: 
- In UK, the BBAN format is: Sort code(6) + Account(8)
- In Spain, it is: Banco(4) + Sucursal(4) + CD(2) + CTA(10)

The default value is BBA.

variable.description:
(Required) Number of the account to be used in the query. 

The number format is defined in the 'account_id_type' parameter.

request.description:
Validates the customer and status of a specific account. The validation also determines whether the account can be associated with a specific product type and contains enough funds for a specific purchase. This operation is available to Santander staff, in addition to physical and business customers.

To send this request, you must provide an account number in the request path. The number uses the BBAN format by default. To use another format, define the format in the 'account_id_type' parameter.

The date format is 'yyyyMMddThhmmssfff±timezone', where fff are milliseconds. If the time zone is not relevant, replace it with 0000.

variable.description:
(Required) Number of the account to be used in the query. 

The number format is defined in the 'account_id_type' parameter.

request.description:
Retrieves a list of statements for an account.

To send this request, you must provide an account number in the request path. The account number uses the BBAN format by default. To use another format, define the format in the 'account_id_type' parameter.

The statements included in the response can be filtered by a time period (start and end dates). They are returned in descending order, with the most recent statement appearing first.

Overall ID of the trace, shared by every span in the trace. 

The value is 64 or 128 bits long.

Position of the parent operation in the trace tree.

item.name: Retrieves the account list of a Santander customer.

header.description:
Overall ID of the trace, shared by every span in the trace. 

The value is 64 or 128 bits long.

Position of the parent operation in the trace tree.

The value is 64 bits long. 

The value is omitted when the span is the root of the trace tree.

Position of the current operation in the trace tree.

The value is 64 bits long.

Do not interpret the value: it may or may not be derived from the value of the TraceId.

Sampling decision.

Sampling is a mechanism to reduce the volume of data in the tracing system. In B3, sampling applies consistently per-trace: once the sampling decision is made, the same value must be consistently sent downstream. This means that either all or no spans share a trace ID.

The possible values are: 
- 0 = Deny
- 1 = Accept
- d = Debug

Device information permitted for the data query. 

You can use this parameter to apply an experience base to optimize data collection.
(Required) Client ID header

Type of the official identification document that has been used in the bank to uniquely and legally identify the customer. 

The possible values are:
- national_id_card 
- passport 
- childs_id_card 
- social_security_number
- foreign_resident_id_card
- driving_license_number
- tax_id

The document type depends on the customer type (for example, only 'tax_id' is applicable for a business customer).

Identification document number. 

The value is country-dependent. 

If the 'Document-Type' parameter is provided, this parameter is mandatory, and the retrieved account must be linked to the customer identified by the document. 

In case of a business customer, the company identification can also be included in this value, and the accounts are retrieved only if the logged-in company representative is authorized to access the company accounts.

Channel access agreement ID.

If a value is provided for this parameter, the requested data is retrieved only if the defined channel access agreement authorises the logged-in person to access that data.

Access channel or operating channel the customer is using. 

If a value is provided for this parameter, the response includes the alias for the specific channel. 

The possible values are:
- web
- mobile
- back office

query.description:
Number of pages to be omitted from the beginning of the response.

The number of rows on each omitted page is determined by the '_limit' parameter.

The default value is 0, in which case the first page is shown.

Maximum number of rows to be included on each page in the response.

Fewer rows can be returned, if the query does not yield that many.

The default value is 5.

Whether balances are to be included in the response.

If the value is 'balances', the response includes the following balance types:
- Available balance
- Pending balance
- Withholding balance
- Overdraft limit
- Overdraft used
- Available without authorized

The default value is empty and returns no balances.

Status of the accounts to be included in the response.

The possible values are:
- Open = Account is open and movements are restricted only by the customer's available balance and account contract attributes. This includes accounts with warnings.
- Closed = Account is closed.
- Pending Closure = Account is being closed.
- Open with Severe Lock = Account is open but there is a lock on some or all account movements.

Whether closed accounts are included in the response.

The possible values are:
- true = Accounts with closed status are included
- false = Accounts with closed status are not included

The default value is true.

If the 'status' parameter is provided, this parameter must not be used.

List of accounts to be included in the response. 

The accounts must be defined with comma-separated account numbers without blank spaces. All accounts must be identified using the account number format defined in the 'account_id_type' parameter. 

The maximum number of included accounts is 20. If you want data about more than 20 accounts, call the API multiple times, for 20 accounts at a time.

Format used for the account numbers in the 'accounts_list' parameter. 

The possible values are:
- IBA = IBAN code
- BBA = Basic Bank Account Number (BBAN) that represents a country-specific bank account number. Each country has its own standards for the format and length of the BBAN. The value is at most 31 char or 35 bytes long. 

For example: 
- In UK, the BBAN format is: Sort code(6) + Account(8)
- In Spain, it is: Banco(4) + Sucursal(4) + CD(2) + CTA(10)

The default value is BBA.

Product family type that can be associated with the accounts. Each account can have a specific product type associated with it, and only accounts that can be associated with the defined product type are included in the response.
The possible values are:
- Acquirement
- loan
- Assurance

Product ID list of products that can be associated with the accounts.

The value is freely defined, and is a comma-separated product ID list without blank spaces.

The maximum number of included products is 20. If you want data about more than 20 products, call the API multiple times, for 20 products at a time.

If this parameter is provided, the 'product_type' parameter must not be provided.
Customer ID of the customer whose accounts are to be included in the response. Applies only when Santander staff wants to access data on the customer's behalf.

request.description:
Retrieves a list of current, savings, and credit accounts of a customer. This operation is available to Santander staff, in addition to physical and business customers.

To use this operation:
- With physical customers, the 'Document-Type' and 'Document-Number' parameters are not needed.
- With representatives of business customers, the 'Document-Type' and 'Document-Number' parameters can be used to identify the company whose information is going to be retrieved.
- With all customers, if the customer has a channel access agreement, the 'Channel-Access-Agreement-Id' parameter can be used to restrict the retrieved information only to data that the channel access agreement authorises the logged-in person to access.
- With Santander staff, the 'Document-Number' or 'customer_id' parameter is required to identify the customer whose data they are authorized to access.

item.name: Creates new contact methods for a physical or business customer.

header.description: (Required) Client ID header

Overall ID of the trace, shared by every span in the trace. 

The value is 64 or 128 bits long.

Position of the parent operation in the trace tree.

The value is 64 bits long. 

The value is omitted when the span is the root of the trace tree.

Position of the current operation in the trace tree.

The value is 64 bits long.

Do not interpret the value: it may or may not be derived from the value of 'TraceId'.

Sampling decision.

Sampling is a mechanism to reduce the volume of data in the tracing system. In B3, sampling applies consistently per trace: once the sampling decision is made, the same value must be consistently sent downstream. This means that either all or no spans share a trace ID.

The possible values are: 
- 0 = Deny
- 1 = Accept
- d = Debug

variable.description: (Required) Customer ID (in local format) to be used in the query

request.description:
Creates new contact methods for a physical or business customer. These can be a landline phone number, a mobile phone number, an email address, and a fax number, as defined in the local bank.

To send this request, you must provide a customer ID in the request path.

Where a contact method already exists, you can modify its preference, use type, and availability details.

If the logged-in person is acting on behalf of a customer, the local bank is responsible for verifying whether that person is allowed to modify the contact information.

If the logged-in person is a company representative, the operation creates new contact methods for the company.

item.name: Retrieves a list of contact methods for a customer

header.description: (Required) Client ID header

Overall ID of the trace, shared by every span in the trace. 

The value is 64 or 128 bits long.

Position of the parent operation in the trace tree.

The value is 64 bits long. 

The value is omitted when the span is the root of the trace tree.

Position of the current operation in the trace tree.

The value is 64 bits long.

Do not interpret the value: it may or may not be derived from the value of 'TraceId'.

Sampling decision.

Sampling is a mechanism to reduce the volume of data in the tracing system. In B3, sampling applies consistently per trace: once the sampling decision is made, the same value must be consistently sent downstream. This means that either all or no spans share a trace ID.

The possible values are: 
- 0 = Deny
- 1 = Accept
- d = Debug

Whether contact methods from local or global data are to be included in the response.

The possible values are:
- Local
- Global

The default value is 'Global'.

query.description: Customer ID (in local format) to be used in the query

Device type for the contact methods to be included in the response.

The global possible values are:
- mobile
- phone
- email
- fax

There can also be documents with local values, depending on the country.

Multiple values can be provided as a comma-separated list.

Purpose for the contact methods to be included in the response.

The global possible values are:
- GENERIC
- ALERTS
- OTP

There can also be documents with local values, depending on the country.

Whether the contact methods to be included in the response are preferred contact methods.

The possible values are:
- yes
- no

Contact ID to be used in the query.

If a value is provided for this parameter, the 'accept-CH', 'device_type', 'purpose', and 'prefer_indicator' parameters must be omitted.

Number of pages to be omitted from the beginning of the response.

The number of rows on each omitted page is determined by the '_limit' parameter.

The default value is 0, in which case the first page is shown.

Maximum number of rows to be included on each page in the response.

Fewer rows can be returned if the query does not yield that many.

The default value is 20.

request.description:
Retrieves a list of contact methods for a customer.

The contact methods included in the response can be filtered by global or local data, device type, purpose, and whether they are the preferred contact methods.

You can also retrieve the contact method for a specific contact ID. If you do this, you must omit the other filters; otherwise the response is a '400 - Bad request' code.

item.name: Retrieves the basic data for a physical or business customer.

header.description: (Required) Client ID header

Overall ID of the trace, shared by every span in the trace. 

The value is 64 or 128 bits long.

Position of the parent operation in the trace tree.

The value is 64 bits long. 

The value is omitted when the span is the root of the trace tree.

Position of the current operation in the trace tree.

The value is 64 bits long.

Do not interpret the value: it may or may not be derived from the value of 'TraceId'.

Sampling decision.

Sampling is a mechanism to reduce the volume of data in the tracing system. In B3, sampling applies consistently per trace: once the sampling decision is made, the same value must be consistently sent downstream. This means that either all or no spans share a trace ID.

The possible values are: 
- 0 = Deny
- 1 = Accept
- d = Debug

Company ID that identifies the company legal name.

If this parameter is not provided, the GW policy generates the JWT without the company claim.

If a value is provided, it must be sent to platform user security and uniquely identify the customer.

Global user ID.

If a value is provided, it must be sent to platform user security.
Customer ID (in local format) to be used in the query

Type of the official identification document that has been used in the bank to uniquely and legally identify the customer.

The possible values are:
- national_id_card
- passport
- childs_id_card
- social_security_card
- foreign_resident_id_card
- driving_license
- identity_documents_not_belonging_to_the_country
(This value applies in Spain only.)
- tax_id

The document type depends on the customer type (for example, 'childs_id_card' is only applicable for a physical customer).

Identification document number.

If the 'Document-Type' parameter is provided, this parameter is mandatory.

The value is country-dependent.

request.description:
Retrieves the basic data for a physical or business customer.

If a customer is a 'VIP customer', restrictions may be placed on the customer's data and Santander staff may not have access to all of the data. If the Santander staff does not have the required confidentiality level, the operation returns the 'highConfidentiallyFlag' property as 'TRUE' and includes in the response only the properties necessary to identify the customer (as defined by each country).

If the logged-in user is a physical customer, the 'Customer-Id', 'Document-Type', and 'Document-Number' parameters are not required.

If the logged-in user is the representative of a business customer, the 'Document-Type' and 'Document-Number' parameters are required, and the data retrieved is for the company, not the representative.

If the logged-in user is Santander staff, either a 'Customer-Id' parameter or both the 'Document-Type' and 'Document-Number' parameters must be used. If the same document is used for more than 1 customer, Santander staff must use the 'Customer-Id' parameter.

response.name: OK
